rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: Every role must pass this test: Is this the best thing this person could put on their resume?
Role
MC
rows.col_2: "I hosted 200+ hours of professional content documenting a DAO launch that got funded. I interviewed the founder, the scientists, the marketers, the lawyers."
rows.col_3: Full video library. Highlight reel. Published on live site. Searchable, linkable.
rows.col_4: Every person in the IonWave system. Nilo (YC/Greylock-backed). All experts. All PM co-founders.
rows.col_5: Interviewing, content production, synthesis, on-camera presence, editorial judgment.
rows.col_6: Aspiring podcasters, journalism grads, content creators who want a signature project, actors who want a real role.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: Admin
rows.col_2: "I ran operations for a venture studio that launched 7 businesses. Managed entity formation, candidate pipelines, and cross-functional coordination."
rows.col_3: Operational playbooks. Process documentation. The Trade itself as a reference.
rows.col_4: Nilo, PM co-founders, product person. Venture studio network.
rows.col_5: Operations, project coordination, candidate screening, tool management, entity formation.
rows.col_6: Career-changers into operations. VAs who want to level up. Business students. People who want startup experience without the risk.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK:
PM Co-Founder
(per cluster)
rows.col_2: "I was co-founder and cluster lead for [domain]. Took 4-8 models from blank to verified. Coordinated experts, managed production, shipped a complete operating system for a funded company."
rows.col_3: The verified cluster itself. Published, attributed models. Contract showing co-founder status.
rows.col_4: Nilo, other PM co-founders, domain experts, investors who funded the project.
rows.col_5: Product management, project management, expert coordination, quality assurance, startup operations.
rows.col_6: MBA students who want real co-founder experience. PMs at big companies who want to build something. Former consultants. Ops people at startups.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: Expert Reviewer
rows.col_2: "I was the domain expert who validated the [formulation/marketing/legal] models for IonWave. My name is on the verified output."
rows.col_3: Credited models with their name. Published expert review. Domain authority artifact.
rows.col_4: Nilo, PM co-founder of their cluster, other experts.
rows.col_5: Domain expertise, quality assessment, technical review, calibration.
rows.col_6: Consultants who want published credibility. Industry practitioners who write/teach. People building personal brands around expertise.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: Product Person
rows.col_2: "I built the consumer-grade launch site for a DAO that got funded. Cinematic quality. Daily video updates. Password-protected investor portal."
rows.col_3: The sites themselves. Live, public, beautiful. Best portfolio piece they have.
rows.col_4: Nilo, PM co-founders, MC, investors who saw the site.
rows.col_5: Product design, frontend development, CMS architecture, video integration, consumer-grade quality.
rows.col_6: Bootcamp grads. Freelancers building practice. Designers bored of SaaS dashboards. Anyone who wants a signature project.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: CoS (IonWave)
rows.col_2: "I was the operator who launched IonWave from funded model to revenue. Built the team, ran the operations, scaled from 0 to [X]."
rows.col_3: The business itself. Revenue. Team. Everything.
rows.col_4: Nilo, Studio 4 network, investors, the entire IonWave team.
rows.col_5: CEO/COO-level operations, fundraising, team building, P&L management.
rows.col_6: People who want to be CEO but need a vehicle. Operators who want equity. People who are overqualified for their current role.

rows.CAREER BOOSTER FRAMEWORK: THE PITCH TEMPLATE (FOR EVERY ROLE)
Every outreach message follows the same structure:
1. WHAT THIS IS: "We're building a company using the most documented launch process ever."
2. WHAT YOU'D DO: [Specific scope, not vague]
3. THE TIME ASK: [Honest hours per week, honest duration]
4. WHAT YOU GET: [Equity + comp + the career artifact]
5. WHY YOU: [Why this specific person is right for this specific role]
6. THE PROOF: [Link to the password-protected site â€” they can see it's real]
The site IS the pitch for every role, not just investors.
MC candidates see the site and think: I want to host that.
PM candidates see the site and think: I want to run that.
Expert candidates see the site and think: I want my name on that.
Product candidates see the site and think: I want to build that.
